headline: Home Depot co-founder: Government shutdown would be foolish
subHeadline: Ken Langone talks spending plan, GOP tax bill and financial deal making.

utterances.speaker: KEN LANGONE, CO-FOUNDER, HOME DEPOT
utterances.sentences: It's a game. OK? They're not going to shut the government down. They know it and we know it. It would be foolish and it would be a black eye for the Republican Party.

utterances.utterance: Right. Look, you can't get blood from a rock. These people...

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: You can get something, though, right?

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: Well, these people that are struggling to make ends meet, you can't take anything from them. But we're missing something in this whole thing about income inequality. What about education? What about preparing these kids? I think there's 60,000 or 80,000 jobs in this city right now that are going crying, $80,000-a-year incomes. But the kids are not qualified to do the work. Why? Because they're not getting quality educations.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: We throw a lot of money at education.

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: Oh, we're number one. Of the 30 nations on Earth, we spend more money per student than any other -- the 30 most developed nations.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: Look, Neil, I don't want to pay any more taxes. I would prefer not to, but I'm a realist. I understand I live in a society where stability is very important.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: I know. But that stability is built on fewer and fewer paying it. I'm not condoning the rich or saying that they're getting -- should be pacified here. But I'm saying that that math can't continue, right? That can't, where you depend on fewer and fewer to pay more and more. Even after this tax cut, we will have half, more than half the people in this country not paying any income tax. I'm not minimizes payroll taxes, other taxes. It's very real to the people who pay them. But the fact of the matter is, that's a shrinking base of people paying, and it's going to shrink more after these taxes.

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: Neil, I agree with that, OK? I agree with that 100 percent. On the other hand, take the carried interest.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: How are we doing? Come on. That's income. OK? That's not capital gains. That's income.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: So, that should be just treated as such?

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: And what bothers -- what bothers me is -- and I don't mean to cast aspersions on anybody. But their -- the added income from the pass- through, their added income is in the abstract. They don't need it.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: You think they're getting away with a lot?

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: I don't think they're getting away with a lot, but they ought to fight over things that matter. I think, for example, for us to be competitive on a global stage in income taxes for corporations, absolute must. Why? The companies overseas are buying our American companies and moving the stuff over there.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Well, what about these companies that have now been incentivized in this plan, supposedly, to bring that money back home?

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: Good.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Let's say they just invest it in their stock. Would Ken Langone be disappointed in that?

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: Because they should use it to grow their companies. Look, number one, remember this. We live in a society. We're claiming we have had tepid growth for the last 10 years. OK? How do you get growth? You get growth by plant construction, by more employment. I will give you something interesting to think about. Here's where I think they ought to be a little more entrepreneurial. Say to all those companies, here's the deal. You take 10 percent of the money you repatriate, and you have to buy a bond issued by the federal government used for infrastructure construction, for bridges, for roads. On top of that, your tax rate will drop to 10 percent. So you're going to net 80 percent, but don't forget the 10 percent of the bonds you're buying, you're going to get that money back when the bonds mature.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Right. Right.

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: I mean, this to me...

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: It's interesting.

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: See, well, look, you know, let me tell you about an entrepreneur. We see things differently. We see the possibilities. We're perennial optimists. We say, not will it get better; it will get better. We need to start thinking out of the box. I agree we--

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Is this tax plan out of the box or in the box?

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I know this much. There are two dragons out there we better be worried about, the deficit and the federal debt. We're going to pay a hell of a price. We are -- at some point are going to be confronted with a serious economic recession. I don't know when. Two years, three years. Who knows? We can't keep doing with what we're doing with 1 percent, 2 percent interest, OK? And look what is happening to the state pension funds. Why? No return.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: No, no, you're right. Very quickly. We have got less than a minute. How is President Trump doing?

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: I'm inclined to watch what he does, period. I like a lot of the things he's doing. I love the people he's put around him. I love the deregulation. We will be -- we were self-inflicting punishment on ourselves.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Do you like what he's doing thus far?

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: I like that. The guys he has got around him, I'm really high on.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: What about him, real quickly, him, Donald Trump?

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: Who am I to judge him, OK? I know this much.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: You sound like the pope.

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: No. No. That was about other things. Here's what I'm saying. I'm saying, watch what he does. Forget what he says.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: OK. Fair enough. Ken Langone, always good seeing you.

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: Nice seeing you, my friend.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: OK. Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: Merry Christmas.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Merry Christmas to you. Where are you going? Just stay a little while here. Holy cow. I know you're a billionaire, and you can do what you want, but just chill already.

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: How do you know I'm a billionaire?

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: I looked it up.

utterances.speaker: LANGONE
utterances.utterance: No, how do I know?

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Bloomberg told me. END Content and Programming Copyright 2017 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2017 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
